comments:
PRODUCT: WSDD 4.0, using Eclipse 1.0

While running under the debugger the following exception was thrown.  A number 
of breakpoints had been set, and the exception was thrown when trying to break 
on the Java message wait().  Successive attempts worked, so this problem is not 
reproducible and not necessarily related to breaking on wait().

Log: Wed Apr 10 16:50:26 EDT 2002
1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
Log: Wed Apr 10 16:50:26 EDT 2002
4 org.eclipse.ui 0 java.util.ConcurrentModificationException
java.util.ConcurrentModificationException

Was this marked as WONTFIX because it was found in Eclipse 1.0?  If so, you 
might want to reconsider because I encountered this with build 20020529 in the 
2.0 stream.  The stack trace is just slightly different, and it was on the 
console, not in the log.  Using IBM JRE 1.3.0.  I don't have exact steps, I was 
using the debugger, setting breakpoints, stepping, etc.
